answers.answer: You have no worries.  Straight to your questions:1) The sort of wound left by a finger tip lancet is not sufficient to seriously increase HIV risk.  The odds your escorts were HIV infected is low anyway.2) The oraquick test is very forgiving.  As long as it touched your gums at all, you can rely on the result.3) Almost no medical condition makes HIV tests false negative or delays seroconversion.  Certainly diabetes (regardess of glucose control), thyroid disease, inslulin, synthroid, or any other medicines do not.'I can't control my concern at this point, it seems to control me' is a clear indication you need counseling to address your anxieties about HIV, which have no basis in fact.  Please discuss it with your health care provider.  I suggest it out of compassion, not criticism.  In the meantime, forget HIV; you don't have it.Good luck--  HHH, MD
Thanks for your reply, and the kind words.  Your reponse gives me great relief!
Dr i have heard you say in many posts that "chances that an escort is hiv is low anyway"What makes you say this?ThanksJames

question: My 3 exposures were all last year, the most recent was in mid October and all of them entailed protected oral (receptive) and protected sex.  The condoms did not break in any of these instances.  At 12 weeks (since last incident) I had an Oraquick Advanced done which was negative.  I have however been experiencing unusual symptoms for me which have been going on for a while.  It started off with a terrible sore throat, now that has mostly gone away.  Now I have a very red unsore throat, still white tonsils, sweaty hands and feet and soreness under my right arm and jaw also burning in left hand. I am not sure if it is involved with lymph nodes or not.1) I do finger stick tests for diabetes, is it possible that when I removed the condom with my hand I may have had her virginal fluid enter my skin through one of these recent finger stick sites?2) When I preformed the Oraquick Advanced test he gave me instructions after I had already swiped my inside cheek, then he told me to get my gums.  I am worried that I did not perform the test correctly.  Is it true that the Oraquick Advanced internal control will let you know if a correct mucosal trasnduate sample is not added?3) Lastly is it possible that because I have diabetes (type 1) last H1AC was 7.6 (not so good) and that I balance my own thyroid (with syntrhtoid) that I may be a late converter?  I am really sorry if I repeated any question others may have asked or if I am crazy for being worried.  I can't control my concern at this point, it seems to control me.
title: Type 1 Diabetic Oraquick protected sex asian escort (x3) No Fever
